title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview on Skype and then was flown in for an in-person interview which lasted for a day. I gave a research presentation and had the opportunity to meet everyone from the lab as well as some faculty members.
Interview Questions: What R packages have you used?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions: It was a easy interview . The questions were mostly about the type of experience with respect to the job description and the resume . The interview and also the recruiting process was very quick .
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for the job

title: Bookstore Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: We spoke over the phone for about 15 minutes. It was very chill and laid back and the questions were easy to answer. After the interview, I received an offer via email.
Interview Questions: They listed names and asked me to say the names in alphabetical order.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Denver, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a Hirevue interview as opposed as an in person interview. Was rejected based on a ridiculous system that doesn’t allow interviewees to speak one on one with the hiring team. If a company ever offers Hirevue interviews, run…
Interview Questions: What about this job stood out to you?

title: First Year Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: After submitting application materials I did a recorded interview on HireVue. It was five questions that allowed responses of three minutes and one untimed question that had a written response. The written question provided an example of a student email and I had to write a response. They also asked for five references, who were sent a skills review. My second interview (final round) consisted of two rounds over Zoom, the first with other first year advisors, and then the second with the hiring committee. For this interview, they sent me a sample student email in advance and asked me to prepare my response before the interview. Both rounds were about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is a challenge relating to diversity, equity, and inclusion that you have dealt with in the workplace? Is there anything on your resume you would like to highlight?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Just one round of interviews and I get the response after a week. The interview was easy and only ask a few of your past experience and many behavior questions, such as why you interested in working with us.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work for the Advancement Department

title: Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: They requested a video of you from a past media interview or a mock simulation of one, in addition to answering written questions and having an over-the-phone interview, prior to offering in-person interviews.
Interview Questions: They asked about some potential crisis scenarios including if a student brought pot-laden brownies to class and distributed them without telling anyone. Would I do outreach to the media?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a video Q&A, where I had to answer questions sent to me from HR and record my answers on a timed video. Was a weirdly anxiety inducing experience. Heard no follow up for months until they decided to not hire for the position.
Interview Questions: Explain my experience working in the field.

title: Assistant Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: First round virtual interview, ~45 minutes. Second round interview on site, full day of panel and one-on-one interviews, as well as a 20-25 minute presentation. Dinner with members of search committee.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest thing you have done professionally?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Talk/Presentation to full room of scientists and students along with individual interviews by staff followed by tour of facilities. Tiring long day followed by interview session with faculty at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: What is your salary expectation?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Hire Vue first-round interview followed by ~ 2-hour Zoom interview. HireVue contained ~ 7 basic questions and took ~ 30 minutes. Zoom Interview met first with the full team and then with leadership.
Interview Questions:
1.	Please tell us a little bit about yourself and why you are interested in working with college students. 
2.	Describe a recent accomplishment of which you were most proud of. 
3.	Please speak to your time management and organizational skills: how do you manage prioritizing responsibilities while completing multiple tasks?

title: Training Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: After greetings and introductions, I was given the opportunity to ask any questions I had. I was thrown off as typically a candidate’s questions are requested at the end of the interview with whatever time is left over. The interview panel was made up of three people of varying hierarchal levels. They took turns reading each question aloud to me. None of the questions were trick questions and all were easy to answer. The panel thoroughly expressed how much they appreciated the questions I asked. So if you want to make a good impression, do your research on the hiring body and ask well thought out questions.
Interview Questions:
Describe a situation when you had an unpopular opinion and acted upon it. 

How do you keep your manager informed as to what you’re working on? 

How would you handle a situation where you’re manager is requesting confidential information that is not there’s to know?

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions:
As if the ‘looking-for-a-job’ process wasn’t already soul-sucking enough, CU Boulder has decided to embrace  the (unfortunate) trend of utilizing HireVue to conduct their first round of interviews. 
If you’ve not had the “pleasure” of experiencing this type of interview, prepare yourself for a fantastic time [/s].
Interview Questions:
Imagine/create a potential scenario that a prospective student might encounter sometime throughout the application process and write them a letter addressing both their concerns and proposing solutions—be specific to the resources offered by CU Boulder. 
…and do all this in 5 minutes.

title: Department HR Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Just ask your questions and this is all. And you could tour the campus and sit there to chit chat with other interview people .And you could tour the campus and sit there to chit chat with other interview people
Interview Questions: Where you graduate scholl from

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: A screening by HR, final round with manager and two additional peers. Approx 30-60 minutes each round. Everyone was pleasant, questions were reasonable and not difficult to answer. Mostly based off of past experiences and projects.
Interview Questions: What type of interactions have you had in the past with students?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: You can expect people who will ask a variety of their own questions; there is no standardization, and people interviewing you are not trained to do interviews.  You should expect a very long, non-stop day.
Interview Questions: Describe your plans for research over the next 5 years.  Pitch a grant proposal idea.  How do you teach, and how do you make your teaching inclusive?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: It went really well, it was a few years ago so not really sure. Communication was good, and the hiring person was really friendly. Not working here anymore but needed a review for Glassdoor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time... type of questions

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: First was a recorded one-sided video interview. Once you get over that it’s a little awkward it was a great way to interview. I enjoyed this because it’s completely flexible on when you can complete it . I think I had about a week timeframe for the deadline. For some people it ends there but I received a next round interview a few days after and it was a zoom interview with 2 managers. Then they never got back to me after the interview which I thought was rude.
Interview Questions: How would you work to create diversity in hiring?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: If you pass the online application and preliminary interview with a potential advisor, the interview day consists of three additional interviews with associated professors; some of which are in similar research tracks while the others are not to provide a range of opinions.
Interview Questions: What are your research interested and explain how your work up until now contributed to them?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Although scheduling the interview went smoothly, I found the office I interviewed with, the Leeds School of Business, very disorganized and surprisingly unprofessional.  People in the office did not seem to get along.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
How do you handle multiple deadlines?

title: Dlf Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions:
First, I had to apply to be in Leeds scholars.
This consisted of answering basic personal questions, submitting an application, and attending an in person interview.
Then, I could submit a 5 min video about joining DLF
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join DLF?

title: Development Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy to apply online and it was great that they listed the salary in the position description in advance so as to not waste time. They also left a lot of time for me to ask them questions to ensure fit.
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions about fit.

title: Social Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I interviewed for a SMM position within the Leeds School of Business. I submitted an application on July 28 and received an invite to do a self-recorded interview a couple weeks later. A week after that I got an e-mail asking to set-up FOUR interviews with the entire marketing team and complete them the following week. I did all the interviews and after the last, I was told it would be about a week before their decision as they were down to 2 finalists - myself and another. 

I got a call 2 days later where they said they offered the other candidate the position because they had more higher ed experience - this was on a Friday. The following Monday, the job listing was re-posted to LinkedIn, Indeed, and the CU Boulder careers page. 

I felt it was rather unprofessional to have me go through this extensive interview process (5 interviews total), not provide any feedback, and then essentially lie to me about the role being filled or that I was one of 2 finalists.
Interview Questions: What is your proudest accomplishment?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview - they asked big questions and you had to answer within 2 minutes. It was stressful. After the virtual interview, I had a Zoom interview with the team and supervisor. I wish I had had the opportunity to visit campus.
Interview Questions: I remember they asked about diversity & inclusion and why CU Boulder.

title: Attorney Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions:
The process went through Hirevue. I was not familiar with the format of the interview as I had to record videos of myself answering to the questions.
I felt very uncomfortable despite prepping and watching hirevue videos online.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for CU Boulder.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Simply upload a resume and professor will reach out to you, the whole process just like daily chat, if your resume is good enough, they just ask you when to start. usually there is no testing on your course knowledge.
Interview Questions: When can you start to work?

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview, asks questions about how to assist people who are looking for housing off-campus. Usually either a zoom interview or in person, only 1 round. Super great team!
Interview Questions: How would you help someone who has no knowledge of finding housing in Boulder?

title: Library Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Pretty informal, one on one with the person from the department that was hiring. Generic questions, how did you handle a difficult situation, when can you begin, what year are you in school
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult teammate

title: Community Center Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Fairly in-depth interview. Consisted of three stages, each meeting with a different group of people (potential coworkers). General questions about the job, how you would handle a given situation, etc. Was given a case study at the end where you had to review what you would two in two situations related to student supervision.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time you dealt with organizational change?

title: Transfer Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Given questions beforehand to prepare and then had a surprise question.  The interview was over zoom with one interviewer and it lasted about 30 min with some time for questions and clarifications.
Interview Questions:
Tell us a little about yourself and why you chose to apply for the Transfer Peer Mentor position? How do you think this position might help you grow toward your future goals?

2. Surprise question

3. Tell me about a time that you had to be self-directed and motivated in completing a project. How did you stay on task and structure your work to complete the project in time?

4. What makes a good event or program? How can you help provide this?

5. Tell us about a time when you received constructive criticism on your performance that you weren’t expecting from an advisor, teacher, coach or supervisor. How did you handle it

6. At CU Boulder we have many students from different backgrounds and identities starting their academic journey together. How would you help a new student who has a different background and is facing different challenges than you, feel welcome at CU?

7. Tell us about a time you lead your peers, even though you didn’t have a formal leadership title. How did you delegate tasks and create “buy in”?

8. Please explain how you view this position and what the job responsibilities are. This question is to help us understand your interpretation of the position and if there's anything that can be clarified.

title: Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Starts with a video interview- a series of questions that you record answers to and submit.  You must get through the HireVue process to move on to an in person interview.  HireVue feels tricky.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest struggle in your work environment.

title: Architect Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Interview 1 was a recorded response to questions submitted
Interview 2 was a live interview with multiple interviewers on zoom
Zoom interview had some technical issues with the coordinator so some interview time was lost
Interview Questions: Offer examples of large scale projects and how was it managed

title: Staff Engineer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Without initial screen, they straight ask to do a take home assignment and followed by meeting with different group of people.

The take home assignment, they ask candidates to spent 3 weeks to implement solution to the problems they have. During the interview, they are asking candidates to solve the problems they have. Overall, they are awfully unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me something I don't know

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions: The interview felt more like a training. I think they just want to see that you're an overall good student and have done well in some harder classes. I ended up doing a core workout with my manager and another tutor at the end lol
Interview Questions: How many credits have you completed?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions:
1. HireVue recorded, one-way video interview 
2. In person interviews
3. Background check 
4. Offer and negotiation, finalizing terms 

I believe this is typical of CU Boulder's process but it may vary between departments.
Interview Questions:
How does your past experience support success in this role? 
How would you approach relationships with various stakeholders in higher ed (internal and external)?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Online. Didn't talk to real person, used HireVue. It was super short, maybe three questions. It was basic behavioral and hypotheticals. There was only one interview for the entire process.
Interview Questions: You have someone going through a mental crisis, a parent of a resident, and a maintencne worker here to talk to you. Which do you prioritize and why?

title: Student Scholarship Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
If you apply through the student portal: 

You are notified of the Interview via email or phone. Then One on One interview if they think you're a good match. 

You will usually hear back within a week.
Interview Questions: Q: What experiences do you think would help you perform in this role?

title: Director of Recruiting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process began with a video recorded interview, where you submit recorded answers through a web browser software. I reached the second round, which was conducted via Zoom. I thought the process was great. Lots of communication and kind folks. The position wasn’t what I expected and I think that was clear to both parties in the interviews. Very cordial process.
Interview Questions: How do you show value in diversity?

title: Leeds Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: They asked some personal generic questions. They also asked questions about business. It was with two current students. It was well thought out and good. The interview lasted around 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your  favorite book?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Just normal graduate school application, there is no interveiw. what you need to do is to fill in the online application form and write a statement of purpose stating what you have done and plan to do in the future research.
Interview Questions: I didn't get a interview through the application

title: Admission Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions:
In place of a phone interview, the initial round involved singing into a platform online and recording my response to predetermined questions. Following this, I was selected to move on as a final candidate and spoke with the entire admission team online. As part of the interview, I was required to make and present an informational presentation about why high schoolers should consider college. 

The entire process seemed pretty fair and straightforward.
Interview Questions: Name a time you disagreed with a rule or supervisor and what you did?

title: Operations Support Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions:
CU Boulder's recruiting department posts ads for entry level positions, but only considers applicants with grad level education and experience.

They don't even give you the courtesy of a screening phone call, to introduce and sell yourself. They make incorrect assumptions based solely off your resume and reject anyone that does not fit their narrow-minded expectations of who can succeed in the job.

CU Boulder's recruiting department is a dumpster fire, much like the institution itself. I suppose one must contemplate the connection between the institution's outdated and deceptive recruiting process and CU Boulder's decaying reputation.
Interview Questions: Nothing. They don't even bother to call you, just send auto-rejection emails.

title: Academic Athletic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was an easy interview, where I was asked behavioral questions about how I would deal with possible situations. It was completely behavioral because the technical skills depend on the student you are tutoring.
Interview Questions: Describe your weaknesses and strengths.

title: Staff Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was in the Zoom meeting. It was 1 hour long and it was very laid back with one interviewer only. They asked about the detail's in my resume and me previous experiences
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult situations and angry customers

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was very easy. communication first began over phone and then moved to email. i met with the hiring team and soon after was offered the position. i was given a tour of the areas i would be involved with and filled in on the various tasks i would be responsible for.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for us

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions:
The screening interview was a one-way remote interview where my answers to questions were recorded on a web-cam and reviewed by HR / others later.  This process felt very dehumanizing and I would highly recommend that anyone who has the opportunity to push back on that kind of screening to do so.  The only pro- to the one-way remote screening interview was that I could do it anytime that was convenient to me within a certain time period. 

The following interviews were great, and they were accommodating to having a remote interview.
Interview Questions: i don't recall specific questions.

title: Academic Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The first round of interviews are done through HireVue video interviewing system where you answer questions with a time limit while recording yourself on video, no playback or re-recording available. The final round was a half-day on-site interview meeting with the team and touring the building.
Interview Questions: How does this role align with your career goals?

title: IT Service Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Denver, CO) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Started with an online interview where I recorded myself answering questions. Passed that and got a panel interview 2 weeks later. Wasn't too bad. Some technical questions and some personality based questions. Good interviewers.
Interview Questions: Name a time you worked on a windows, mac, and phone system.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary interview where you answer questions to a blank computer screen-  awkward.  In person interview afterwards.  Low stress overall.  Usual questions about background and experience.  What's your greatest weakness etc
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake

title: Community Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first part of the interview was a series of questions served by a computer with timed periods to respond. It was pretty standard with few surprises but strange to talk to a computer and have to time out replies. After passing that I had an inperson interview with the hiring manager and team members in my department. They had a rubric to score me on as we talked. They were interested in behavioral evaluation but the interview ended up having little to do with the ultimate job function and it did not represent the team dynamics well or set realistic expectations.
Interview Questions: Have you ever experienced failure in a job.

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: They change the interview process every year, but it typically caters to the most outgoing and extroverted individuals. They make instant judgements so be sure to dress the part and share your name and pronouns (if you feel comfortable doing so). They also ask you to teach them something for 5 minutes. Extra points if you bring props.
Interview Questions: How do you approach diversity and inclusion and how do you hope to bring that into a community?

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Met with the lead researcher for the lab after emailing to set up a time. We talked for about 30 minutes and had aligning research interests, and there was an opportunity for position funding through the college.
Interview Questions: What modeling experience do you have?

title: Account Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process took about a month all together. It took about two weeks after the closing post date for an interview. The interviewer asked about 8 questions down a list, all standard, what are your strengths/weaknesses, experience, I believe one scenario case.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in campus solutions

title: UMC Business Events Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: It took about a month after I applied to recieve a call for an interview. The interview consisted of 2 - one on one interviews and then a final group interview. Total interview time was about 3 hours
Interview Questions: What about this position interests you?

title: Sponsor Accounts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions: A reference check was completed with skillsurvey. Then, I was invited to the interview. I first met with the department lead and manager. This was followed by the team one would be working with. I should mention they made the job seem horrible. Specifically, it was stated that it involves a high volume of transactions that would require one to work over 40 hours a week. I left feeling unsure about whether I would want the job. However, everyone was very nice and they seemed like good people.
Interview Questions: Describe you experience with multitasking and dealing with conflicting priorities. What strategies and methods do you use?

title: Program & Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: After sending in my CV and cover letter, I was invited to participated in an  automated video interview with no human on the other side. It was comprised of 5 - 6 questions with 30 seconds to prepare your response and 3 minutes to respond to the camera.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? When you are stressed what do you do?

title: Economist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Denver, CO) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy and detailed. Interview process took months, requiring multiple phone interviews and an in-person tour of the campus.  Weighed highly on experience and whether or not I was good fit for group.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the position?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: (dept: Engineering) Most of the interviews with professors were casual, as they had already read my application. Mostly we chatted about the research being done in their labs. One interview was more technical: the professor asked about simulation software and experience.
Interview Questions: What are your plans after graduate school?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screen. Then multiple in-person interviews with the middle, and then senior library staff.  A LoC training and test was administered following the initial round of screening.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with the Library of Congress Classification standards?

title: Events and Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: HireVue is cold and painful. It is the standard first part of the selection process at the University of Colorado Boulder.  The overall timing of the selection process was met.
Interview Questions: Real case scenarios related to the position that you are applying

title: Computer Lab Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the University website. Then from there the manager for the position reached out for available times to come in for an interview. The final stage consisted of interviewing in person with a few people from the department.
Interview Questions: What year are you planning on graduating?

title: Compensation Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It is a pretty time-comsuming interview process. First you need to submit all the standard things, then you need to write an essay and do a simulated task.  After that, you will be asked to record a video of yourself answering questions. For people who are not used to talking to themselves in front of the computer, it can be nerve wrecking. After that, you will be invited for an in-person interview. I didn't go to the in-person interview as I got another offer, but I was told that there were about 7 candidates chosen for the final interview. So it is a very long competitive process.
Interview Questions: Q: What was the biggest challenge in your previous work and how you overcame that?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and easy going.  The College of Engineering BOLD center office needed assistants to help out with office management and scheduling rooms for student societies.  They were looking for full time students that use the space and are part of student societies. Found out about the position from work of mouth and sent in an email to the director who directed me to the application.
Interview Questions: What improvements would you like to see made?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: They brought me in and I stood in front of a panel of managers. I talked about my skills and what I could offer to the job. Also demonstrated proficient operating skills of a windows operating system live in front of the panel. They asked some questions about previous experience on my resume.
Interview Questions: Why  would you be the best fit for this position?

title: Peer Advisor Work-study Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: A very standard interview with the typical questions asking about your strengths/weaknesses, why you want to work there, what your knowledge of financial aid is, why you would be a good fit, how well you perform under stress, etc. Very friendly and welcoming. Dress business formal and arrive early for parking (never show up late).
Interview Questions: How much do you know about financial aid?

title: HR Service Center Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First was a  Hireview Interview
Second was an In person or Zoom interview
I received a quick turn around and good communication
Answered all questions I had for them during the interview process
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you were overwhelmed by your workload and how you handled that stress.

title: Dedicated Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had a Zoom online interview with the other two members of the DDS staff.  They were pleasant to converse with and I believe would have been great to work with. However I emailed them twice over a three week period  and received no correspondence from them even though they set up everything prior. Found out through a random HR rep with a generic response that they offered the position to someone else. Their hiring process could use a human touch with some care.
Interview Questions: What's the most important skill to have when delivering technical support?

title: Financial Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was hosted by Hirevue. It's pre-recorded interview. You have 1 minute to read the question and 3 minutes to record. It's better to get use to record yourself before you record the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?

title: Administrative Job Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: CU has recently begun implementing more virtual interviews, and by virtual I don’t mean in order to protect everyone from the pandemic. I mean impersonal, you get asked a question by a computer and then get three minutes to record yourself answering. And even after this you sometimes don’t have the decency of a rejection.
Interview Questions: Very basic question about your strengths/weaknesses followed by HIGHLY specific personal question irrelevant to the overall job.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: I was not interviewed for this specific position. I just applied online and got the offer through email after a month from the time I send them an email. It is part of the graduate program.
Interview Questions: I was not interviewed for this position. I just applied online and got the offer after a month.

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: The conversation about past experience and why I wanted to work there. I shared my past job experience and that I knew friends who had worked there before in the past or currently did and enjoyed their time there.
Interview Questions: What customer service experience do you have?

title: Programming Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied online and was offered a second interview in the form of a video interview where I recorded myself answering a series of questions. The third phase was an in-person interview, followed by check on references and background.
Interview Questions: In which unique ways will you contribute to the team here?

title: Business Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call for an in-person interview where I met with 2 people.  One was the supervisor for the position, the other was another manager in the office.
Interview Questions: Asked pretty straight forward questions.

title: Student Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Professor will ask you questions about the subject. My subject is Artificial Intelligence so questions pertaining to that. The best approach is to know your subject well and give conceptually correct answers.
Interview Questions: Best Search Method and why?

title: Pre-health Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview is pre-recorded and done through HireView. Fort this position the interview questions were sent ahead of time so that the candidate had plenty of time to prepare STAR responses. There are opportunities to practice the recorded interview process and you have the option to hide the screen that shows you interviewing. During the actual interview it will have the question and then give you 60 seconds (you can skip if you want) to prepare before recording your response. You have 3-4 minutes to give your complete response.  All questions were behavioral based and most of them were specific to pre-health students.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you were overwhelmed with responsibilities at work. How did you respond? What was the result?

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received email from HR to schedule a video interview with department lead. Corresponded with department lead to schedule interview. Was provided with video call link and other information by the employer. Was told if I had difficulty accessing the call I could call in by phone. During the video interview, I was told references would be contacted by CU HR (automated survey) within a few days. No references were contacted but HR emailed saying the team was still deliberating. The following week, still no references were contacted and was never contacted again by either HR or department lead, despite one email and one voice mail follow up on my behalf.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with travel?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Three separate panel interviews with members of the office the position would work for and with members of other offices the position would interact with (student affairs, admissions, tech services)
Interview Questions: What challenges do you think you will face in taking on this role.

title: Marketing Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: A bit lengthy but smooth overall. Was kept in the loop with the status of my application. Video interview required before meeting with any in person team members. Overall a positive experience.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience l?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I have sent the email inquiring about position directly to the principal investigator.
We've been talking via Skype ~1 hour, discussing my educational background, practical skills, things that I liked in my PhD studies and things that I am proud of. Then he described his lab and typical routines.
I got an invitation to attend the on-site interview, but I declined.
Interview Questions: Describe your future plans.

title: Executive MBA Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed atmosphere, friendly counterpart. Precise questions. At the beginning there was enough time to make preparations and to get to know each other. Good preparation is important here. Information about this was exchanged before by mail
Interview Questions: Presentation of the research focus and explanations of the methodology were necessary

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was a slow interview process with multiple weeks of silence. The communication was not the best during the interview process. Went well overall and was offered a job. Happy with my decision.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a challenge you faced at work and how did you resolve it?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the supervisor and was asked what I could tutor and why I wanted to be a tutor. The whole thing was pretty easy and not too stressful. The person interviewing me was very pleasant and I was offered the job on the spot. I was given the paperwork to fill out and that was that
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Student Assistant IV Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions: I received the email from the university that I needed to have an interview before I took my job. So, I made an appointment with the officer, and I talked with her. It was little nervous, but it was not terrible as what I thought. She was very kind to me. It ended well, and I got the offer from University.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to take this job?

title: Network Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was amazing.  A combination of linux, network and security. The interview walked over some of my past experiences with Linux and I was asked to solve a particular scenario using Puppet.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous experience in Linux. Explain puppet

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Starts with a video interview with about 7 to 8 questions.  The video interview is prerecorded so you have to sit in front of your computer and answer questions with no one on the other side.  But the question were not difficult, just got annoyed when the internet dropped.  Questions are mostly behavior based, speaking to previous experiences.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want the role?
Tell us about a time you....

title: Learning Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I actually liked the recorded online interview that they used in the first round. It was not a phone/skype interview. I got a link, and I recorded my responses to questions on my own time. There was a specific time it needed to be submitted by, but I could record whenever I wanted up to that point. The in-person interview was great. Everyone was really nice and wanted to make sure I was a good fit.
Interview Questions: What do you feel that you can bring to this department that we do not already have?

title: Academic Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 2 panel interviews - one 3:1 and 2:1. Both were relaxed and it was more of a conversation with interview questions thrown in. Each panel was one hour with a short break in between.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at CU?

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was over the phone with the supervisors. The interview itself was incredibly easy and at the time the job sounded like a dream come true based on the information I received during the interview.  The supervisors asked basic questions about me, my education, experience, etc and sold me on the higher-level work as a manager. I accepted the job and worked for CU for several traumatic years.  Unfortunately, the supervisors turned out to be a well-known bully, compulsive liar, and liability that the University has been attempting to fire for years.  They lied to me during the interview and about most things including the level of job duties to attract me to the job. In hindsight, many of the interview questions were to determine if I would be willing to cover for their indiscretions, misuse of money, and harassment of students and staff.  Beware non-classified jobs at CU...they are not covered by an employee union and employees have little to no recourse against bad-actor staff members or tenured professors.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to keep secrets?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions: not too bad, just be professional and be prepared to answer some questions in the realm of social justice. their culture and mission is to create "inclusive excellence" and to get there, their role is to play social justice warriors.
Interview Questions: teach aliens how to make a PBJ

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a two part interview. There was a hirevue which was a video interview. A few weeks later, they contacted me for an in-person interview. This was a three-part interview with their staff, managers and director. They provide a lot of details of the day and with who you will meet. They also offer breaks in between.
Interview Questions: They asked a lot of scenario questions focused on financial aid.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Went into conference room, was interviewed by two very nice ladies who asked about my background in administrative work and my experiences as a student at CU. They detailed what my job description would be but also said it depended on the needs of the department I was in. They were very prompt in their response time and overall I had a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple, competing priorities?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple. Did well in the course. Professor asked if I am interested in the position and conducted an interview. Questions were generally about debugging and my general career goals.
Interview Questions: How would I debug a non-working board?

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Laid back and generous. First had to answer three questions over email regarding part tutoring experience and diversity. Then got a call back for in-person interview at the Writing Center on campus. The head of the department was thorough but kind. He asked questions about my prior experience and any issues I have had in the past, as well as focused on pedagogical theory I had learned in my masters program.
Interview Questions: Mock tutoring session with a student paper, with the head of the dept acting as the student.

title: Linguistic Annotator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went in for one interview after my application had been accepted. There were three women who were hiring for different projects and each asked some questions. Overall, the interview was about fifteen minutes and felt fairly casual. I was impressed with their expertise and they made the entire process very accessible and friendly.
Interview Questions: If you come across a question or problem that you cannot find the answer to, what would you do?

title: Norlin Library Circulation Desk Employee Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very standard. A couple of questions will concern your general "fit" with the departments culture. A few questions will also concern your work ethic. Nothing should be a surprise here. Just come prepared and well groomed/
Interview Questions: Why do you think you deserve this job?

title: ASAP Tutor-Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy with personality type questions much like any HR interview. The interviewer was very humble and did not try to ask any confusing questions and kept it simple and to the point. She made sure I understood the roles and responsibilities of the position and made sure I am capable of handling multiple student groups at a time
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student who is not understanding the concepts and failing a course?

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions:
They ask questions related to job. Applied via email. Sent resume. Overall questions were related to resume and job related. 
Questions were related to 
Programming Questions.
Web Design Questions
Databases
Embedded
HTML design
CSS design
Interview Questions:
Programming Questions.
Web Design Questions

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was polite and friendly. Took ten minutes just to have conversation, which was nice. She appeared genuine in her representation of the position, and avoided cliche and cop out interview questions.
Interview Questions: What is your experience like in being involved in and completing multiple projects across different deadlines.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Informal discussion with graduate advisor and professor I would be working for.  I had already been working with the hardware / software for the class, had taken the class, and knew the professor from prior interaction.  The department chair stepped in and attemped to force the position to be one that paid half the amount for twice the required hours.
Interview Questions: What level of commitment I could provide to the class in terms of doing office hours, grading, etc...

title: Assistant Professor, Clinical Track Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions: A 1.5 day process, beginning with dinner in Wednesday evening, followed by breakfast at 7am the next morning, interviews with a dozen people and presentation of my research. Next day, another breakfast with faculty and then taught a class. Grueling but good. They court people aggressively.
Interview Questions: Many questions about my research and my moral stance on the issue.

title: Contracting Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter sent information on the multiple-step process: online application with three parts, solo video-taped interview, one-on-one live video, then live group video interview. Asking all the correct questions for a senior role, not a purely administrative or specialist role.
Interview Questions: Their questions were about my background and experience relating to position, my handling of difficult and complex situations and the size and scope of contracts managed.

title: Research Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief in-person interview, found out about offer later that day. Was referred to the position by someone who works in the same department on a different team. Spent some time talking with other current employees of the hiring team.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to this line of work?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Full day interview, mostly panel orientated. Tour of campus. Opportunity to meet with a variety of staff members, faculty, and deans. It was long day, but a great experience. I walked away hoping to get the job, and I was offered the position the next week.
Interview Questions: Fundraising experience, experience working with difficult people, career goals

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was relatively simple for me. I was referred for the position by a friend, so I emailed the supervisor/hiring manager for the position and got a reply within a couple days. We scheduled an interview shortly afterwords. The interview itself was pretty casual. Only me and the supervisor. Most of the questions were situational and were asked from a piece of paper that looks like it is taken out for every interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle an angry parent who is calling with complaints?

title: Admission Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: very extensive, interview with associate director, interview with 3 person committee, and then a 15 minute presentation to about 15 staff members followed by a single question from each person in attendance
Interview Questions: what does diversity mean to you

title: Accounting Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Many people at the interview, some don't care, some want to show their knowledge. Basic question, strength, weakness. It took 25 minutes and there was nothing particular about it. You can dress business casual.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: A brief interview section with an extensive training and role playing section on on-the-job activities. The role playing section involved one of the interviewers playing a student and a situation from a prompt was read. The interviewee must then help the student solve the issue at hand successfully. The interviewers want to see how you handle situations and what skills you use.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Educational Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I found the position through the university's job website and revised my resume and crafted a cover letter to submit online. I got a confirmation email and within a week after I submitted my application, HR notified me that I advanced to the first round. I did a HireVue interview, and then received a call that invited me to an on-campus day-long interview. I think I did really well, but didn't end up being offered the job. I was notified that I didn't get it by the end of the week; the whole process seemed comparatively fast. Other interview processes that I previously and subsequently did at this institution took much longer.
Interview Questions: The dean asked if I had gotten my PhD.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was referred by a supervisor at CAPS, met for an in person interview for 30 minutes. I was called later that day and told I got the job. I believe that my employee reference likely set me apart.
Interview Questions:
How will you balance work and school?

How do you plan to keep organized in this job?

What are you majoring/minoring in?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: very easy, beahavior questions, situations questions mostly, want to know about you more than asking questions, want to know you have a plan, are here for a degree, the supervisors are very nice and there are almost all students to help you our in work, flexible schedules
Interview Questions: situational questions

title: Alumni Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: First interview is online through a third party. The interview is a set of pre-selected questions that are displayed on the screen. You have 30 seconds to prepare an answer and 2 minutes to give your response. This interview is not live. The answers are taped and submitted individually. During the interview your screen will by you giving the response so it is a bit awkward and distracting. I would cover up the screen when responding.
Interview Questions:
If in this position what would be your first event produced for the alumni? 
What past experience makes you fit for this specific role?
Why should we hire you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy hiring procedure. There was not much to prepare. One to one interview and asked about my background. Had a brief discussion about the compensation and I was selected to work. Easy interview procedure.
Interview Questions: How well can you manage customers.

title: Retail Operations Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Applied Online.
Notified by email that I would need to answer about 10 questions via video recordings on a website they provided.
Notified to submit references who then had to fill out online surveys about me.
Was called back for an on-campus interview. Prior to the interview, I was provided via email with blueprints and stats of one of the stores on campus and told to prepare a ~10 minute presentation about how I would increase efficiencies in this store.
At the on campus interview, was interviewed by a panel of about 6 people, gave my presentation and spent about 75 minutes answering their prepared questions.
One more followup call with a couple additional questions that I was later told were questions asked of candidates after my interview - and were questions asked of me to maintain consistency among the interviews.
After this, I was offered the job - at which point both a background check and a driving record check were each performed.
Interview Questions: What are some methods of loss prevention you would employ to reduce breakage due to theft?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Emailed to set a date. Flew me out. Interviewed with department faculty, about 30 minutes with each faculty member. After interviews had dinner with all grad students, and then happy hour with all faculty. Left they following day, took the shuttle from Boulder to Denver International Airport.
Interview Questions: How does your research speak to the aims of the department?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a one on one in person interview. The interviewer asked simple questions about information technology and other questions about working within the campus. It was an pretty easy interview overall.
Interview Questions: How do you approach helping a customer.

title: Research Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Single interview to determine which of the 50+ applicants would be hired.  15 people were interviewed, and after 1-2 weeks references were checked.  Make sure to have good references.  This can make or break it for you as interview performance in the sciences is only one factor during the application process.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected.  Most difficult was probably, "what makes you the best fit for this position?"

title: New Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. You're required to answer some basic questions, submit location prefs, and attach a resume and cover letter to your application. The application closes early December, and they send out invitations for interviews early January. The process for reselecting past RAs happens a bit earlier. 

My interview was late January. They did all of the interviews in one day, with lots of hall directors and current RAs on hand. You sign up for a time slot and are randomly assigned to a HD and RA in that timeslot. I ended up with an RA and HD who were not anywhere near the top of my location prefs, and neither had read my application. I also hadn't lived in either of their dorms.

The HD introduced himself and then took notes on his laptop for the rest of the ~20 minute interview without asking questions. I'm not sure if this is standard or not. All three of us had a double sided sheet of paper with questions printed on it. The questions were fairly typical, asking things like:

Tell us an experience when you experienced good customer service.
What do you think will be most challenging about being an RA?
How will you try to connect with students with whom you have nothing in common?
If you've indicated any hall preferences on your application, can you tell us why you think you are a good fit for them?
Interview Questions:
The last question involved a fake scenario where you're an RA and have to prioritize several tasks. I don't remember all of them, but here are the ones I do remember in no particular order.

Again, you are an RA. It's 7PM Thursday and you've just returned to your room. 
1. A girl has written a note on your door asking to talk because she's been in a fight with her roommate.
2. Another girl has dropped a note saying that the A/C in her room is broken and that it's freezing.
3. Your HD has sent an e-mail asking you to take care of the girl in (2) because her mother has also e-mailed the HD.
4. You get a text from some classmates asking you to study with them for a test next Tuesday.
5. Your friends have texted you saying they'll be stopping by later tonight to pick you up to go out and have fun.

title: Learning Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was not actually interviewed for the position. The job opened up mid year and my name was put forward to fill the position. I believe this position is typically filled in house. I do not believe they advertise the job, preferring to choose someone known within the department.
Interview Questions: Was I interested in the position?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online process, then they send emails to schedule a phone interview. Then we talk on the phone for 20 minutes. Three days later, they  gave me the offer letter.
Interview Questions: Why choose the school

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Denver, CO) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted through email with a link to HireVue for an online recorded interview, which consisted of about 5 questions, each of which I was given two minutes to review and the website immediately started recording me (whether I had an answer ready or not!) for three minutes.  About two weeks later I was sent an email saying some anonymous "expert panel" had reviewed all the interviews, but I was not selected to move forward in the interview process. No explanation! No interaction with any people during the entire process, it was an incredibly impersonal and off-putting process! They said to stare at the camera to make it "feel" like there was eye-contact being made, but it's not natural and was impossible for me to maintain!
Interview Questions: Given a mock storyline situation (It's 8am, you have a presentation at 10am, you haven't finished your presentation, the delivery guy calls you and is lost, etc., etc...) what do you do?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Typical of all academic interviews - phone interview followed by in-person 2-3 day visit w/key faculty members & grad students. Watch out for promises not put in writing! Generally collegial audience for presentation, but I was subjected to immediate efforts to get me to take sides in departmental battles.
Interview Questions: In appropriate assumptions made about "diverse" aspects of my identity.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Depends on which jobs you are applying for, however, I have been through many of the CU Boulder hiring processes. Usually, for an advisory role, you will have an interview with the Director of the Department (1-on-1). He/She will usually ask very standard questions, like "Why are you interested in this position?" A lot of these questions stem from the specific position you applied for, but generally try to outline your strengths, and very specific examples about how you contributed to a project, workshop, or how  you engaged with students in the past. 

Afterwards, you then move on to a meeting with much of the members/staff of the department. The interview questions will follow a similar format. These element is probably the most important, as I also served on search committees for interviewees. This really gives you the opportunity to win over the department's staff, highlight your specific skill set and talents, and also, share a little bit about yourself as a person. Being a "correct" fit for the department may ultimately decide if you get the position or not. Passion always garners interest.
Interview Questions: Q: "Tell us about a time when you applied yourself to a project, your organizational/planning efforts for that development, and the outcome? What else could have you done better?"

title: Events and Outreach Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: Took a while to hear back! University has a very long hiring process. Had to have three initial interviews before hiring, but with weeks in between. Interviews are done in large groups rather than small. Panels are comprised of different personnel in the office or within its volunteer network. You don't get to speak directly with the supervisor until much later on. This makes answering some questions for the interviewers hard because they are unfamiliar.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were very standard.

title: Web Content Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Started with a group interview (solo, multiple CU people on the call), then went to solo interviews with boss and boss' boss. Process took a little less than a month. References were called.
Interview Questions: what's your weakness

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2014

Interview Questions: What major are you and why do you want this position?

title: Research Associate Interview

Interview Descriptions: Just had a phone call with my advisor and talked about my previous research. We went over a ppt slide I had prepared. Another student was on the line as we'll.  took about 30 minutes or so. We exchanged emails to set the details of the hire like starting date etc.

title: Mail Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty standard process, I applied for it online, after a week they called me for interview, and at the interview they explained what the duties for this position, they also checked my availability. It was one by one interview, then I accepted the offer.

title: Community Assistant Interview

title: Director Interview

title: Virtual Machine Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Met my employer and got the job instantly. Really easy. No technical questions were asked. He was nice and told me the job I would be doing. My job was to install virtual machine and box software for students. Very easy task.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about helping students?

title: Field Interviewer Interview

She explained the nature of the research project, the goals, data collection, and the training that would be provided before I would be sent out to screen households for youth eligibility.  She made it sound interesting to me as a social worker and a student of violence prevention.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience talking with people and asking them questions?

title: Outreach Crew Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder (Boulder, CO) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and short. I interviewed on the University's campus and only had to do one interview. It was at the UMC building on CU Boulder's campus. It was mainly get to know you questions with a couple behavioral questions. The interviewer was very nice and respectful. Overall the interview process was quick and efficient. I found the questions to be quite general, most were addressing overall attitudes, values and beliefs.
Interview Questions: What would you do to improve this position?

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I originally sent in my application, and had a phone interview about 2 weeks later.  It was a standard phone interview with standard interview questions.  I was later notified that I was put on a waitlist for the job, and I didn't hear back from them until 1 year later.  I was then called up saying that an opening suddenly came up, and they offered it to me.
Interview Questions: Are you open to having shifts on nights, weekends, and holidays?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder
Interview Descriptions: There was a preliminary phone screen which was followed by an on-campus interview with two individuals.  The final round included a group interview with a panel of students, as this was a student facing role.  Offers were made with a week of the final interview.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with ambiguity?

title: Student Assistant II Interview

Interview Descriptions: Quick questions to gauge your reliability and personality. 5 minute conversation. They are more interested in ensuring student employees mesh with current ones in terms of personality than any past experience.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Colorado Boulder in Apr 2013

title: Student Assistant Interview

Afterwords, if it did, then the applicant would be called in for a one stage, one stage interview before the hiring team makes their decision. The interview consisted of three other interviewers. One person was the hiring manager for that department and the other two interviewers had positions directly in that field of work.

title: IT Technician II Interview

title: Resident Advisor Interview
